criteria: Understanding of the Importance of Conflict Resolution
descriptions: The student does not identify any steps of conflict resolution.
The student identifies one step of conflict resolution incorrectly.
The student identifies one step of conflict resolution correctly.
The student identifies two steps of conflict resolution correctly.
The student identifies three steps of conflict resolution correctly.

The student correctly identifies all key steps of conflict resolution: (1) Define the source of the conflict. (2) Look beyond the incident. (3) Request solutions. (4) Identify solutions both parties can support. (5) Agreement.
The student does not demonstrate the ability to apply any conflict resolution steps.
The student attempts to apply one conflict resolution step but does so incorrectly.
The student applies one conflict resolution step correctly.
The student applies two conflict resolution steps correctly.
The student applies three conflict resolution steps correctly.
The student effectively applies all key steps of conflict resolution in a given scenario.
The student does not express any understanding of the importance of conflict resolution.
The student minimally expresses the importance of conflict resolution with little justification.
The student expresses the importance of conflict resolution with some justification.
The student clearly expresses the importance of conflict resolution with reasonable justification.
The student thoroughly explains the importance of conflict resolution with strong justification.
The student demonstrates a deep understanding of the importance of conflict resolution, including its benefits for relationships and overall well-being.
